:::{.fragment}
"Whatever makes you uncomfortable is the best opportunity for growth."
:::

:::{.fragment}
"We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing"

## some advice 

it might feel like there's *so* much to learn, but focus on committing to
learning what you need to accomplish your goals.

<img src="graphics/memes/focus-meme.jpg" alt="Yoda: focus, you must">

## do side projects 

whether it's "fancying your figures" or trying out features you've never tried
before, side-projects can be fulfilling and are often sources of inspiration for
new ideas that translate to your main projects.

<img src='graphics/memes/side-projects.webp' alt="there can be a temptation to have too 
many side projects, or too many unfinished side-projects">

## read other people's code 

reading other's code will give you the chance to see new ideas in action and
consider the pros/cons of their programming style compared to yours.

<img src="graphics/memes/read-others-code.png" alt="xkcd comic describing a situation where someone's
code looks like a mess">

<a href="https://google.github.io/styleguide/Rguide.html">Google's R Style Guide.</a> 
<a href="https://jef.works/R-style-guide/">JEFworks R Style Guide.</a>
